required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Role for Biochemical Assays and Kayser-Fleischer Rings in Diagnosis of Wilson Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Role for Biochemical Assays and Kayser-Fleischer Rings in Diagnosis of Wilson Disease

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators aimed to identify factors associated with symptoms and features of Wilson disease from a large cohort during long-term follow-up

detailed_description.textblock: Wilson disease is an autosomal recessive disorder that impairs copper homeostasis and is caused by homozygous or compound heterozygous mutations in ATP7B, which encodes a copper-transporting P-type ATPase. Patients have variable clinical manifestations and laboratory test results, resulting in diagnostic dilemmas. Therefore, the investigators aimed to identify factors associated with symptoms and features of Wilson disease, thereby give timely diagnosis for patients.

primary_outcome.description: Serum ceruloplasmin levels were collected among patients with wilson disease. After confirming a non-Gaussian distribution, the reference range of serum ceruloplasmin level was determined.
The measurement of 24-hour urine copper excretions were collected and measured.
The presence of Kayser-Fleischer Rings among patients with wilson disease were confirmed via slit lamp.
Brain Magnetic Resonance Imaging of all patients were collected and analyzed.

arm_group.description: Patients were clinically diagnosed according to the Leipzig Score and included in the study when they were confirmed to carry ATP7B pathogenic variants in 2 different alleles.

intervention.description: All patients with wilson disease should receive low copper diet

biospec_descr.textblock: This study was approved by the ethics committees of the local hospitals. After obtaining informed consent from the affected individuals or legal guardians, genetic DNA were collected and reserved.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- genetically diagnosed patients with wilson disease
Exclusion Criteria:
- Deny follow-up

overall_official.affiliation: Second Affiliated Hospital, Zhejiang University School of Medicine

facility.name: Second Affiliated Hospital, Zhejiang University School of Medicine
